subject: Applications
question: What is the register?
answer: The Land Register contains more than 25 million titles showing evidence of ownership for more than 87% of the land mass of England and Wales.

subject: Applications
question: How do I update or correct the register?
answer: If anything in the register changes or it is incorrect you can update or correct the register.

subject: Applications
question: How do I change my name on the register?
answer: You must send HM Land Registry an application to change the register when you change your name. You do not have to pay anything to do this.

subject: Applications
question: What are the registration fees?
answer: Identify which fees to pay for HM Land Registry applications and services.

subject: Applications
question: How can I find my deeds?
answer: You may be able to find out current and past information about a registered property, such as its previous owners. The register may give more details about rights over adjoining land.

subject: Applications
question: How do I search the register?
answer: Find information about a property in England or Wales, even if you do not own it. Search by address to find the owner, how far its general boundaries extend and whether it’s at risk of flooding.

subject: Applications
question: What is an official search?
answer: An Official Search protects the title of the property for 30 business days (the priority period) to allow an applicant to lodge their application to purchase the property.

subject: Applications
question: How do I search the index map?
answer: The index map contains information on all land and property that’s registered or being registered with HM Land Registry. You should use it to find the title number of a property that doesn’t appear in a search of the register.

subject: Applications
question: Official copies of register or plan: registration (OC1)
answer: Use this form to apply for official copies of the register or plan or a certificate in Form CI on a developing estate. If you want to apply for official copies of documents relating to a specific property or an approved form of charge, use form OC2.
text_downloads:
OC1 FormMS Word, 90KB
OC1 FormPDF, 130KB, 3 pages
text_informationOne: Send the completed form with the correct fee to our standard address.
text_informationTwo: Send the completed form with the correct fee to our standard address.

subject: Applications
question: Official copies of documents: registration (OC2)
answer: Use this form to apply for official copies of documents relating to a specific property or an approved form of charge. If you want to apply for official copies of the register or plan or a certificate in Form CI on a developing estate, use form OC1.
text_downloads:
OC2 FormMS Word, 78KB
OC2 FormPDF, 117KB, 2 pages
text_informationOne: Send the completed form with the correct fee to our standard address.
text_informationTwo: Read more information in practice guide 11: inspection and application for official copies.

subject: Contact Details
question: Phone HM Land Registry
answer:
We’re open Monday to Friday (excluding Bank Holidays), 8am to 5pm.

We have fewer advisers available due to the ongoing coronavirus (COVID-19) measures. Our service is usually quietest between 8am and 9am.

Read about our temporary support measures and see our help pages for information on common queries. Find out about call charges

Contact centre

English language
0300 006 0411

Welsh language
0300 006 0422
text_informationOne:
You will hear a list of options when you phone us. Pick the appropriate option to speak to someone to help you with your query.

Customer support teams are trained in HM Land Registry casework procedures. They refer queries to our case owners only where necessary.

subject: Contact Details
question: HM Land Registry address for applications
answer:
Send your applications and correspondence by post to our standard address. If you are a portal or Business Gateway customer, you can send these electronically.
Address for members of the public

HM Land Registry Citizen Centre
PO Box 74
Gloucester
GL14 9BB

HM Land Registry

GL14 9BD

Weymouth
text_informationOne:
Please use our standard addresses, unless:
  • your application is:
    • for Land Charges (including applications for a search of the index of proprietors’ names in form PN1)
    • for bankruptcy
    • for Agricultural Credits
    • the Procurement and Commercial Team
    • for Local Land Charges
    • to sign up to our Business e-services
    • to serve legal proceedings on the Chief Land Registrar
  • we have told you to send your applications or correspondence to an alternative address

subject: Contact Details
question: Contact us online
answer:
Please use the below contact form to get in touch

We'll use this address to contact you

subject: Applications
question: How do I update my postcode?
answer:
There are two ways availble to update your postcode or the postcode of another property.

  1. Online: Update postcode
  2. By post: Fill in the Updating registered owners' contact address form below and send it to us, using the addresses provided

text_informationTwo:
Use this form to ensure that the contact details we hold for you are up to date. This is important if your property is registered. You, the applicant must be one of the registered owners of the property whose address is being updated or act for them.

When we receive an application regarding your property, we may write to you about it. If your details are not up to date, you may not receive our letter or email.

You can provide us with three different addresses, including an email address and an address abroad. Download and complete this form to add an address or update your existing contact details. There is no charge for this service.

This form is only applicable to update the address of the registered owner(s).

subject: Applications
question: How do I find out who owns a property?
answer: To find information about a property in England or Wales, even if you do not own it, visit Search for property information from HM Land Registry .

subject: Applications
question: How do I find out how much a house has sold for?
answer: To find out how much a property sold for in England and Wales, visit Search sold property prices .

subject: Applications
question: I want to know what my property boundaries are
answer: To find out about property boundaries, visit Search for boundary information .

subject: Applications
question: How do I register my house?
answer: To find out how to register land or property with HM Land Registry, visit Register land or property.

subject: Applications
question: What are the HM Land Registry registration fees?
answer: To find out the fees for common applications, visit HM Land Registry: Registration Services fees.

subject: Applications
question: I want to download datasets from HM Land Registry
answer: To access datasets about all registered land and property in England and Wales, visit Use land and property data.

subject: Applications
question: I want to view HM Land Registry practice guides
answer: To view all of the HM Land Registry practice guides, visit Land registration: Practice guides.

subject: Applications
question: I want to apply for a business e-services account
answer: To apply for a HM Land Registry Business e-services account, visit Apply for HM Land Registry Business e-services.

subject: Applications
question: How do I search for local land charges?
answer: To search for local land charges, visit Search for local land charges.

subject: Applications
question: How do I remove someone's name from the deeds if they've died?
answer: When a joint owner of a property dies, fill in form DJP to remove their name from the register. form DJP.
text_downloads:
DJP FormMS Word, 97KB
DJP FormPDF, 183KB, 2 pages
text_informationOne: Send the completed form to HM Land Registry, along with an official copy of the death certificate..
text_informationTwo: Read more information in: Update a property record when someone dies..
